title: Macbook Pro 13 A1502(820-3476-A) Freezing
message:
Hi Macbook start and chime then on login screen freeze , I try to boot in safe mode and its working ,it was liquid damaged and I replaced keyboard ,try use another ssd from working Macbook still same .
In diode mode I only see difference from working board is PP1V05_S0 line on working one I have 0.103K and broken one 0.072K I dont know s that normal .I guessing is something with graphic issue maybe
thx

title: Macbook Pro 13 A1502(820-3476-A) Freezing
message:
Is a good and charged battery plugged in?

Was there some film residue from liquid around the RAM or the CPU? Was the corrosion by the CPU mosfets?

This is often fixed by an ultrasonic at 80c for a minute for me, dislodges the filmy junk around the RAM and under it that you cannot see.

title: Macbook Pro 13 A1502(820-3476-A) Freezing
message: Hi no liquid was only on keyboard and little bit around jtag connector ,remove connector and still same no corrosion around CPU and RAM ,will try ultrasonic later thx

title: Macbook Pro 13 A1502(820-3476-A) Freezing
message: Pretty sure there is corrosion somewhere. Disconnect all stuff that is not needed like IO board, iSight, etc.

title: Macbook Pro 13 A1502(820-3476-A) Freezing
message: Cleaned in ultrasonic and still same

title: Macbook Pro 13 A1502(820-3476-A) Freezing
message: Fixed with all credits to Gurmon, replace with second screen and now works perfect,its very strange wish if someone can find reason WHY

title: Macbook Pro 13 A1502(820-3476-A) Freezing
message: Now I have sound problem no speakers output ,it was worked before ultrasonic now sound dead

title: Macbook Pro 13 A1502(820-3476-A) Freezing
message: Then more surprise put the first Lcd in second macbook and works perfect CRAZY
